medical_history.chief_complaint: Periumbilical pain with nausea and vomiting
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began experiencing periumbilical pain around noon after eating popcorn, described as if someone tied a knot at the belly button and was pulling it down. The pain was more diffuse and intensified despite taking Tums and Motrin 400 mg. Symptoms improved with lying down but were accompanied by nausea and loss of appetite. The patient vomited water and, after some attempts to eat, continued to vomit throughout the day. Pain continued unabated and was aggravated by movement in the car.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension; History of three cesarean sections.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of gallstones and cholecystectomy among several female relatives.
